Create Crew Controller for Async Simulation

create_controller.Rd

Initializes a crew controller to manage parallel R worker processes for asynchronous random walk simulation.

Usage

create_controller(n_workers = 2, seconds_idle = 60)

Arguments

n_workers

Integer. Number of parallel workers to create (default: 2). Recommended: 2-4 for medium grids, 4-8 for large grids.

seconds_idle

Numeric. Seconds of idle time before worker shutdown (default: 60).

Value

A crew controller object with initialized workers.

Details

The controller manages a pool of R worker processes that execute walker step functions in parallel. Each worker maintains its own local cache of the grid state and subscribes to updates from the main process.

Workers are automatically started when the controller is created and can be cleanly shut down using cleanup_async().

See also

create_pub_socket, cleanup_async

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Create controller with 2 workers
controller <- create_controller(n_workers = 2)

# Use controller for parallel tasks
# ... simulation code ...

# Clean up when done
cleanup_async(controller, socket)
} # }
